text: Any HubSpot devs looking for a fun morning task? Getting a strange React error in the design manager when trying to edit the global content of a custom module.

Whenever I try to edit a repeated group in my global header module, the DM hangs then crashes. In the console it's saying it's a React error, and when I debug it it's giving me:

`Objects are not valid as a React child (found: object with keys {url, open_in_new_tab, no_follow}).`
hey mark
how can i repeat the same

Hey man, basically I have a custom global module with a repeater group. When I click "edit global and smart content" then try to edit one of my repeated groups (the pencil icon), everything hangs then crashes. Happy to jump on a call and share my screen if it would help

I want to add a custom module to my flexible column by default
I’ve done as in the snippet but get the error
Must specify either module_id or path, but not both

If i remove the path i get the error
No module is specified

If i remove the ID i get the error
no name provided

Any ideas on what i need to do?
okay, let's do it
The code actually works i just get a warning but i guess i’ll just leave it
that is the usage snippet that was provided in the sidebar of the dm?
yeah
strange
no se
That warning is actually a bug for modules in flexible columns, you can ignore it. We’re looking into a fix.
Does the blog_recent_topic_posts function care about what order the topic is in the post? Like if it goes topic A, B, then C, does it only choose posts where topic A is first or does that not matter?
Hi, is it possible to not include the {{ standard_header_includes }} in a template?

Two things that HubL variable does for a template:
1. Ensures the HS tracking code is placed on the template
2. Ensures a page using that template can be edited within the content editors in HubSpot.
There is likely other functionality at play, but the above two are what I know of.
ok thank you

so kind of adding to what James said, you don’t want to remove that.

If you’re creating a partial, you set the file as a partial at creation.
does filtering work with blog pagination?  like if i want to use reverse?  seems to work on a per page basis
Hey Patrick, I don't believe it matters. I think it just pulls in the most recent posts that include that topic regardless of the other topics also added to that post.
Jason, ok that would make sense to me, but i wanted to check becuase I vaguely remember that being the case a few years ago for some reason
Yeah I just did a quick test on my end and can now confirm that it should be showing regardless of other tags/topics applied to the post :thumbsup:
Perfect, thanks for doing it, appreciate it!

Yeah from my experience the filter applies to the posts on that specific listing page (e.g. listing page 3) and not all blog posts on that blog. I haven't found any ways to sort an entire blog using a HubL filter across pagination but would be very curious if someone was able to find a workaround for it.
as would i.  trying to set up a reverse chronological dropdown on the listing view

If it is a drop down, is it something you could use this for (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions#blog-recent-posts>) and then sort this on the for loop of this function?
the limit is an issue
well.  not yet, but will be.  am trying to apply this to the primary blog and they are a pretty active on content creation

Got it yeah that is tricky. I believe I've been able to combine the recent posts function with recent posts by topic function in the past (so it sorts through recent posts for each topic and then the recent posts in general) but that isn't a great workaround if they don't plan on using topics/tags heavily and if they don't plan on using a lot of unique topics/tags.
c'est la vie. :slightly_smiling_face:  thanks for reaching out
